name: Trinity
description: First fission device test, first plutonium implosion detonation

name: Little Boy
description: Bombing of Hiroshima, Japan, first detonation of an enriched uranium gun-type device, first use of a nuclear device in military combat.

name: Fat Man
description: Bombing of Nagasaki, Japan, second and last use of a nuclear device in military combat.

name: RDS-1
description: First fission weapon test by the USSR

name: Hurricane
description: First fission weapon test by the UK

name: Ivy Mike
description: First cryogenic fusion fuel "staged" thermonuclear weapon, primarily a test device and not weaponized

name: Joe 4
description: First fusion weapon test by the USSR (not "staged")

name: Castle Bravo
description: First dry fusion fuel "staged" thermonuclear weapon; a serious nuclear fallout accident occurred

name: RDS-37
description: First "staged" thermonuclear weapon test by the USSR (deployable)

name: Grapple X
description: First (successful) "staged" thermonuclear weapon test by the UK

name: Gerboise Bleue
description: First fission weapon test by France

name: Tsar Bomba
description: Largest thermonuclear weapon ever tested—scaled down from its initial 100 Mt design by 50%
First fission weapon test by the People's Republic of China

name: Test No. 6
description: First "staged" thermonuclear weapon test by the People's Republic of China

name: Smiling Buddha
description: First fission nuclear explosive test by India

name: Pokhran-II
description: First potential fusion/boosted weapon test by India; first deployable fission weapon test by India

name: Chagai-I
description: First fission weapon (boosted) test by Pakistan
